;64 岁的主厨 Fai 在中餐厅用餐周五，他在香港好莱坞广场举行的联邦宴会上听到令人毛骨悚然的尖叫声，一名男子持刀刺伤两名女子，这显然是一次震惊全城的随机袭击。

;

;他最终成为为数不多的人之一勇敢的路人试图阻止袭击者。两名年龄分别为 22 岁和 26 岁的女性在被反复刺伤后死亡。

;

;“我只是想阻止他伤害别人。”但是我没有设法帮助这两个受害者。我失败了，”在钻石山持刀袭击事件发生一天后，这位不愿透露姓名的厨师说道。

;

;“我绝对不是英雄……也许确实有点冲动。 ”

;

;警方称这名 39 岁的袭击者患有精神障碍，他在现场被捕。

;

;网上流传的视频显示，附近一家餐馆的厨师试图在警察到达之前用两个凳子阻止袭击者。

;

;当他突然听到尖叫声时，厨师说他正在吃饭休息。

;

;“我以为只是一些孩子在尖叫，但后来我听说了刺伤的消息，就去看看。走廊很干净，我看到一名男子手里拿着刀攻击一名女子，”他说。 “太可怕了，但我想阻止他伤害任何其他人。”

;

;

;“他一脸震惊，往前挪了一步，我又打了他一拳，但他没有做出任何攻击， “ 他说。 “因为我打了一个陌生人，所以伤害他让我感到不安。”

;

;厨师说，袭击者然后慢慢走向走廊尽头的名录板，泪流满面。 “也许他冷静下来，意识到自己做了什么。”

;

;Fai 然后站在袭击者面前，拿着一个与胸部齐平的凳子，以防止他刺伤其他人，而一些居民则试图抢救

;

;虽然没有人帮助他，但这位厨师表示他并不担心，因为人们应该首先保护自己。

;

;香港特首对购物时双重谋杀表示悲伤mall

;

;“我同意网友说我冲动的说法。我的家人也批评了我，但他们很感激我没事，”他说。

;

;星期六早上，袭击发生的走廊沿线至少有四家商店关门，其中包括化妆品零售商 Sasa 这两家受害者在袭击发生前拜访过。

;

;回忆起这起事件，一名负责行政事务的莎莎女售货员表示，她仍然对袭击感到恐惧，但不会寻求咨询。

;

;“我听到动静，连忙躲了起来。我不敢看现场，”这位只透露自己姓崔的女士说。 “但昨晚他刺伤那个女人的那一刻一直萦绕在我的脑海中。”

;

;事发现场附近一家韩国杂货店的店主照常上班，并讲述了冲过去保护顾客的经历。

;

;“我好害怕。我和两个顾客躲在储藏室里，但我们没能关上大门，”一位姓黄的店主说。

;

;三丽鸥礼品店一位姓千惠的女售货员，关闭一位目击袭击事件的同事说，他们去了其中一名受害者被袭击的地方，不得不请假一天冷静下来。

;

;一位不愿透露姓名的内衣店店主也说，同事们

;十几名身穿防刺背心的警察，星期六在商场巡逻。数十名居民在现场献花悼念逝者。

;新西兰航空公司被 AirlineRatings.com 评为全球最佳航空公司，一个航空公司安全和产品评论网站。

;

;该航空公司击败了在 2021 年和 2022 年蝉联冠军的卡塔尔航空公司，稳居榜首。该网站将新西兰航空公司的新 Skynest 经济舱和该航空公司的安全记录列为排名最高的两个原因。

;

;新西兰航空公司在最佳经济舱位列第一；卡塔尔航空率先推出商务舱；新加坡航空公司被评为最佳头等舱航空公司。

;

;太胖不能坐飞机？新西兰航空公司在登机前对乘客称重

;

;在美国航空公司中，达美航空排名最高，排在第 15 位。该评级网站将最佳低成本航空公司评为美国的西南航空公司和欧洲的瑞安航空公司。

;

;AirlineRatings.com 主编杰弗里托马斯说：“在我们的客观分析中，新西兰航空公司尽管与前五名的得分非常接近，但在许多关键领域都排名第一。”

;

;他继续说道：“与全球所有航空公司一样，新西兰航空公司在大流行期间和之后面临严重的中断，今年，风暴和旋风带来巨大挑战。该航空公司的反应很好。”

;

;AirlineRatings.com 使用的标准包括机队年龄、乘客评论和盈利能力。

;

;根据该网站，排名前 10 位的航空公司是新西兰航空公司;卡塔尔航空公司;阿提哈德航空；大韩航空；新加坡航空公司；澳航；维珍澳大利亚/维珍大西洋；长荣航空；国泰航空；阿联酋航空。

;

;由于他的职位，阿德万享有免于起诉的外交豁免权，但法国政府敦促黎巴嫩当局取消这一决定并允许

;

;“鉴于上述事实的严重性，我们认为黎巴嫩当局有必要取消黎巴嫩驻巴黎大使的豁免权，以便利法国司法部门的工作当局”，法国外交部周五晚间表示。

;

;第一位 31 岁的女性于 2022 年 6 月提出申诉，称她于 2020 年 5 月在大使的私人公寓内遭到强奸。接近确认 Mediapart 报告的调查。

;

;她杀死了强奸她的男人。墨西哥一家法院判处她 6 年监禁

;

;根据法新社看到的她的证词，她明确表示对发生性行为缺乏兴趣，并且尖叫着哭了起来。

;

;这名当时担任编辑的女士已于 2020 年向警方报案，称阿德万自 2017 年以来在他的职位上与她在办公室发生争执时殴打了她。

;

;她说她没有报案投诉是因为她不想“破坏”大使的“生活”。

;

;根据投诉，她与大使有关系，大使实施“心理和身体暴力，每天遭受羞辱”。

;

;第二位 28 岁的女性去年 2 月提出投诉，她说自己拒绝性关系后遭到了一系列身体攻击。

;

;她声称 Adwan 曾试图打她在去年诺曼底世界和平论坛期间与他的汽车发生争执后。

;

;那个 70 年代秀演员丹尼·马斯特森被判犯有强奸罪

;

;她还指责大使试图去年 12 月，她在家中将她的脸按在床上，让她窒息而死。

;

;“我的委托人对所有形式或形式的侵略指控提出异议：口头、道德、性，”阿德万的律师卡里姆·贝鲁尼 (Karim Beylouni) 说。 /p>;

;“在 2018 年至 2022 年期间，他与这两名女性有过不时发生争吵和分手的浪漫关系，”Beylouni 说。

;

;一位知情人士称，巴黎司法警察已结案.

;

;在法新社要求置评时，巴黎检察官办公室表示目前无法立即置评。

;美国国防部长劳埃德·奥斯汀周六提出了一个更“敏捷和有弹性”的愿景” 在华盛顿与北京争夺影响力的关键地区与东南亚共享防御战略。

;

;奥斯汀在新加坡香格里拉对话安全论坛上发表讲话说，一项协议代表着“历史性进步”使用更多菲律宾军事基地表明美国对该地区的承诺，该地区位于中国的后院。

;

;“美国每天都在与我们的朋友更紧密地合作，”他说。

;

;“我们正在与我们的盟友密切合作，以升级我们在该地区的部队态势。我们正在使我们的存在更分散、更敏捷、更有弹性。这将为该地区带来更大的稳定和安全。”

;

;菲律宾在 4 月表示，它将允许美国使用台湾海峡和有争议的南中国海附近的另外四个基地，从而使美国的军事基地数量增加。华盛顿可以在该国使用的军事地点增加到 9 个。

;

;中国“尽最大努力”调解乌克兰战争：英国的本·华莱士

;

;分析人士指出，奥斯汀的外交闪电战旨在扩大到东南部亚洲领导人的目标是向人们传达这样一个信息，即美国是一个真诚的伙伴，随时准备帮助各国对抗中国的“胁迫”。

;

;五角大楼负责人周五还与 10 位东南亚国防领导人举行了非正式会议在会议期间，他重申了拜登政府对该地区的“大力支持和承诺”。

;

;美国将“继续与东南亚地区接触，以加强各国之间的防务合作” ，新加坡国防部援引 Austin 的话说。

;

;随着美国加强与该地区国家建立信任和信心的努力，他分别会见了新加坡国防部长 Ng Eng Hen 和印度尼西亚的 Prabowo Subianto。

;

;新加坡国防部补充说，Austin 与 Ng 讨论了亚太地区的地缘政治发展，两位领导人“同意美国继续参与的重要性”。

;

;“他们就如何进行交流交换了意见建立一个强大、开放和包容的地区架构，美国重申他们对国防能力建设的贡献，”它说。

;

; -新加坡和美国之间的有益伙伴关系。”

;

;普拉博沃在与奥斯汀会面后告诉《亚洲周刊》，印度尼西亚与美国“关系非常好”。

;

;“我们有这是一次非常好的会议……我认为我们希望继续密切合作，”他说。

;

;当被问及是否讨论了中国时，这位部长拒绝置评，但观察人士表示，北京在该地区日益增长的影响力可能是其中的一部分

;

;南洋理工大学外交政策助理教授 Dylan Loh 表示，中国将“不可避免地”出现在讨论中，但强调会谈不会是单向的。

;< p>;“我相信其他人会给他留下深刻印象，他们不想看到美中竞争失控，”他说。

;

;东南亚国家坚称他们不想随着两个世界大国在台湾和尖端芯片限制等问题上的竞争加深，不得不在美国和中国之间做出选择。大多数国家与北京有着牢固的贸易关系，并依赖华盛顿来确保地区安全。

;

;大国必须避免“外交冻结”以稳定世界秩序：澳大利亚总理

;

;Yongwook Ryu，助理新加坡国立大学李光耀公共政策学院教授表示，奥斯汀在与该地区军事领导人的会谈中可能会提出围绕南中国海的问题并加剧台湾海峡的紧张局势。

;

;北京声称对几乎整个资源丰富的水道拥有主权，包括菲律宾和越南在内的其他几个国家对此提出了相互竞争的要求。

;

;马尼拉近几个月多次就中国船只在该海域的存在提出外交抗议有争议的海域，包括 4 月菲律宾巡逻船和中国海警船在有争议的浅滩附近险些相撞。

;

;在周六的小组讨论中，菲律宾还暗中挖苦了北京。< /p>;

;国防部长 Carlito Galvez Jnr 指出，“好篱笆造就好邻居，因为只有当邻居有明确的界限并尊重既定界限时，关系才会真正友好”。

;

;对柳贤振来说，奥斯汀本可以传达东南亚国家“需要参与维护和促进地区和平与稳定”，并向他的同行保证美国是关心该地区的“真正伙伴”。

;

;奥斯汀本可以借此机会强调中国是“地区不稳定的根源，所有人都需要共同努力建立和维护基于规则的秩序”，此前他曾在 2018 年呼吁北京冒险拦截美国和盟国的飞机。他周六的演讲。

;

;他补充说，美国将“支持我们的盟友和伙伴，因为他们保护自己免受胁迫和欺凌”。

;

;Chong Ja Ian，国家政治学教授新加坡大学表示，奥斯汀与地区领导人的双边会谈是为了保持与该地区的良好关系。

;

;毫无疑问，他指出中国也会这样做，但至少对华盛顿而言，它需要保持进入东南亚的通道亚洲。

;

;尽管取得了进展，但南海准则充满了“无法逾越的”分歧

;

;Ryu 表示，各国可能会接受华盛顿加强该地区合作的努力。

;

;“东南亚国家对这两个大国有不同的看法和利益，所以都会得到一些人的支持，也可能不会得到一些人的支持，”这位学者说。

;

;“最大的成就美国所能做的就是让东盟国家——尽可能多的国家——在[关于]区域战略评估和不稳定来源的同一页面上，”他说，指的是东南亚国家联盟的 10 个成员国。< /p>;

;奥斯汀将于周六继续与其他主要地区领导人举行会谈，他还表示，五角大楼将加倍加强其联盟和伙伴关系，包括加强与南海国家的合作。

;

;人们越来越担心富士山两侧可能发生事故，因为距离 7 月 1 日日本最著名山峰的登山季开幕越来越近。

;

;这座 3,776 米高的山脚下一个城镇的市长提议限制过夜尝试的人数山顶的攀登是为了保护徒步旅行者，而不是让徒步旅行的设施不堪重负，而一间山间小屋的主人告诉《亚洲周刊》，他已经停止接受过夜住宿的预订。

;

;Hiroyuki Ikeda富士宫登顶路线第 8 站池田馆小屋的主人说：“今年夏天想登山的人太多了，情况有点可怕。我可以预见很多问题和可能出问题的地方。”

;

;在通常情况下，每年约有 30 万人在登山季节登上富士山，今年的登山季节将于 9 月 10 日结束。这个数字缩减了近年来，由于冠状病毒大流行，山间小屋的所有者限制了运营或完全关闭。此外，在过去的两个夏天里，日本几乎没有外国游客。

;

;然而，随着外国游客涌回日本，许多人将登上富士山顶峰，情况发生了变化。他们的愿望清单。 Similarly, Japanese who have put off an attempt now feel that the opportunity has arrived.

;

;This year marks a decade since Mount Fuji was granted Unesco World Heritage status, which could also explain the growing enthusiasm for scaling the iconic peak.

;

;Local authorities are bracing themselves for the coming climbing season, with Shigeru Horiuchi, the mayor of the town of Fujiyoshida, appealing for help from the Yamanashi prefectural government.

;

;“We have to consider limiting the number of climbers on the mountain,” Horiuchi said in mid-May.

;

;“We will study what measures we can take,” the Yomiuri newspaper quoted the mayor as saying. “We want to ask the prefectural government to take measures in cooperation with us.”

;

;There is no system in place at the moment to limit the number of people setting out to climb the mountain, or to verify that they are properly equipped for the hike. Every year, people who are convinced that the ascent will be an easy stroll are caught out by the testing conditions, including the dramatic change between the traditional starting point halfway up the mountain and at the top, where the temperature can be below zero and the powerful winds make it feel a good deal colder.

;

;The routes up the peak are marked but there have been cases of people missing markers in the past, particularly at night, and becoming lost. There is also the very real possibility of a hiker turning an ankle on the rock-strewn tracks, falling or being struck by falling rocks, while hypothermia and altitude sickness can also be a problem at the very highest elevations.

;

;But Ikeda fears that the sheer volume of people is going to pose the biggest danger this summer.

;

;“I can understand that people who have not been able to climb the mountain for a few years want to do it this summer, but it will be dangerous and there are going to be problems,” he said.

;

;“My worry is that people assume they will be able to take shelter in my hut or in the other huts on the route, especially if the weather is particularly bad,” he said. “But we only have space for 180 people to stay and if we are full, there will be no place for other people to rest.

;

;“They will have no choice but to keep climbing, which could be dangerous if the conditions are bad.”

;

;The association of mountain lodge operators has also called for a halt to the practice known as “bullet climbing”, by which hikers arrive at the start of the hike in the evening, climb all night without resting or acclimatising to the altitude, and reach the peak in time to see the sun rise.

;

;In a statement, the organisation said, “Climbing overnight increases the risks of accidents and altitude sickness because of exhaustion. In recent years, 'bullet climbers' have become a problem. The local government has announced that this dangerous form of climbing should be stopped.”

;

;There are four major routes to the summit, with the Kawaguchiko, Subashiri, Gotemba and Fujinomiya routes all having a number of mountain lodges. An ascent will typically take between five and seven hours, while the descent usually lasts around three hours.

;“The US' comments on Taiwan ignore the facts, distort the truth and are completely wrong,” Jing said on the conference's sidelines.

;“First, there's only one China in the world, and Taiwan is a sacred and inalienable part of Chinese territory.

;“Second, the one-China principle represents the consensus of the international community.

;

;“Third, it is the common aspiration and sacred responsibility of all Chinese people, including our Taiwan compatriots, to complete the reunification of the motherland.”

;“It has frequently transited through the Taiwan Strait to flex muscles and induced other countries to interfere in the Taiwan question.”

;

;Other countries have their own policies on Taiwan, which do not entirely align with Beijing's.

;The United States is studying a US$250 million financing package to build a key transport corridor in southern Africa aimed at securing access to critical minerals like copper and cobalt used in electronics and batteries for electric vehicles.

;

;US President Joe Biden said the US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) was conducting due diligence for financing the Lobito Atlantic Railway Corridor, which stretches across Angola to link the Katanga mining regions in the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC) and the Zambian province of Copperbelt.

;

;The Lobito corridor serves as the key route to transport minerals to export markets from inland mining sites in the DRC and Zambia to Angola's Atlantic Port of Lobito. The project would cut transport times from weeks to days, according to mining companies in the region.

;

;The DRC is by far the world's largest exporter of cobalt, accounting for about 70 per cent of global production, while Zambia is rich in both copper and cobalt. Angola is one of the top oil producers in Africa and is also home to diamond mines.

;

;But the deal would put the US in direct competition with China, whose companies have vast investments in Zambia's copper-producing region and in the DRC, from where China sources more than 60 per cent of its cobalt.

;

;“It is going to enable … us to better access clean energy and digital connectivity across the entire region,” Biden said at the recent Group of Seven summit in Hiroshima.

;

;The investment is part of the Partnership for Global Infrastructure and Investment (PGII), a G7 flagship infrastructure initiative that aims to mobilise US$600 billion over the next five years, to rival China's multibillion dollar Belt and Road Initiative.

;

;The US has been trying to carve out access to critical minerals in Africa, but China controls most of the market for processing and refining the minerals, including cobalt, lithium and graphite, which are vital for the world's transition to green energy.

;

;One of the main segments of the Lobito corridor is Angola's Benguela Railway, a 1,344km (835 mile) link that connects the Port of Lobito to the eastern city of Luau, on the border with the DRC.

;

;The railway was the main transport link for minerals before it was shut down during the Angolan war from 1975 to 2002.

;

;After the war, Angola rebuilt the railway using a US$1.8 billion oil-backed credit line from China Exim Bank. The reconstruction by China Railway 20 Bureau Group Corporation (CR20) was completed in 2014.

;

;But the track in the DRC remains in bad shape and Zambia would have to build its own rail link to connect to it. Chinese mining firms such as China Nonferrous Metal Mining, which operates mines in the DRC and Zambia, have used the Lobito corridor as an alternative transport route. Currently, the DRC and Zambia transport their minerals by road to ports in South Africa and eastern Africa.

;

;Tim Zajontz, research fellow at the Centre for International and Comparative Politics at Stellenbosch, South Africa, said Chinese investment to restore the Congolese portion of the Lobito corridor, or extension lines to the Zambian border and across Zambia's North-Western Province, had so far failed to materialise.

;

;“Chinese firms will continue to compete for infrastructure projects along the Lobito corridor. Chinese investments are likely to concentrate on improving transport connectivity along corridors that link the Zambian and Congolese copper belt with the Indian Ocean,” Zajontz said.

;

;For example, Chinese investors are keen to upgrade the Tanzania-Zambia Railway Authority in the east through a public-private partnership.

;

;Gyude Moore, a senior policy fellow at the Washington-based Centre for Global Development, and a former public works minister in Liberia, said reliable rail transport in the region would be a priority for G7 partners who wanted to de-risk critical mineral supply chains by shifting away from China.

;

;“The Angolans are open to negotiating with other partners and not exclusively China,” Moore said, adding that countering China might be a part of the reason.

;

;“But I think this interest is also driven by economic priorities ... China has been the dominant player in the infrastructure sector across the region, over the last two decades. I doubt we are about to see a significant shift away because of Washington's offer.”

;

;Chinese companies are also making infrastructure upgrades to enable them to move minerals to port easily. In March, subsidiaries of Jiayou International Logistics and Zijin Mining Group announced a US$363 million joint investment to improve roads and infrastructure between the DRC and the Port of Lobito.

;

;Foreign Minister Qin Gang's tour showed Africa what China can offer: analysts

;

;In November, Angola signed a US$450 million deal with Portuguese infrastructure group Mota-Engil – partly owned by China's CCCC – to operate rail services and logistics in the Lobito corridor as well as other infrastructure linked to the Angolan coast. Mota-Engil will also maintain road infrastructure connecting Lobito to Luau as part of a 30-year concession.

;

;US plans to invest in transport infrastructure along the Lobito corridor could be a geostrategic measure stemming from growing competition over sensitive supply chains, according to Zajontz.

;

;“Boosting US investments in transport infrastructure and logistics along the Lobito corridor aims at securing access to critical raw materials like copper and cobalt which have become a vital interest in Western capitals,” said Zajontz, who is also a lecturer in global political economy, at Technische Universität Dresden.

;

;Zajontz said the planned investment package and the aim to close infrastructural gaps to establish a coast-to-coast corridor showed the growing importance the US now attached to infrastructure in Africa.

;

;“Washington is keen to prevent situations in which Chinese firms control critical supply chains from the mines to the ports because of concerns that this could be leveraged by Beijing in case of worsening relations with the West,” said Zajontz, a co-editor of the book Africa's Railway Renaissance: The Role and Impact of China.

;

;Gilson Lazaro, an associate professor in the sociology department at Agostinho Neto University in Luanda, said although China's loan was used in part to rebuild the railroad almost entirely, Beijing missed an opportunity to commit resources to the infrastructure on the scale of the Southern African Development Community (SADC).

;

;“China was the biggest investor in Angola over the last two decades. And the Lobito corridor was part of this infrastructure. The works did not go beyond the partial reconstruction of the railway line and the supply of some locomotives,” Lazaro said.

;

;“For that reason, I argue that China, as Angola's largest trading partner since 2004, missed that opportunity that is now being seized by the United States.”

;

;Angolan president is expected to reduce country's dependence on China

;

;The US realised there was an opportunity to increase its trade partnership with Angola through that investment, insofar as the advantage does not only involve Angola, but a group of countries under its strategic axis of influence, Lazaro said.

;

;“The Lobito corridor is not just a railway line. It is a geostrategic infrastructure with political and economic implications,” Lazaro said.

;

;“It is also a way of influencing Angola's political choices and its relationship with China.”
